subject: p13606683
Findings: Linear opacities within the left lung base appear unchanged compared to recent prior examination and are consistent with plate-like atelectasis or scarring. Flattened hemidiaphragms and hyperexpansion of the lungs suggest underlying obstructive pulmonary disease. No confluent consolidation is identified. There is no vascular congestion or pulmonary edema. A trace left pleural effusion is newly identified. Cardiomediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits. A prosthetic cardiac valve is again noted. There is no pneumothorax. Median sternotomy wires appear grossly intact.
Impression: Unchanged left lower lobe scarring/plate-like atelectasis. New trace left pleural effusion.
